  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA, UPON INSPECTION LOOSE CAP. NOT EN OUGH PACKING MATERIAL USED. A LOT OF NEGATIVE SPACE ALLOWING CONTENTS TO SHIFT ON IMPACT. BOTTLE CAP NOT SECURED AND NOT PACKED WELL ENOUGH TO PREVENT MOVEMENT UPON IMPACT. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT INSIDE HAZMAT TOTE AND STORED IN HAZMAT CAG

item.title: Report X-2023090564
item.description:
Report X-2023090564

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 bottles of Master Care Pro-Blue outdoor coil cleaner leaked from loose caps. The bottles had a seal but the caps were not secured. Only molded foam on top of the bottles was used as inner packaging materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2023090553
item.description:
Report X-2023090553

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded in a van when it was discovered wet. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Both plastic bottles leaked from loose caps causing the shipping box to get wet. The shipper only used slotted partitions as inner packing materials. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the wet package it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report I-2023090133
item.description:
Report I-2023090133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-20
  • City: Jacksonville
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A mother had her infant baby with her on American Airlines Flight 1680 when the baby soiled its diaper creating a strong odor in the cabin. The mother got up to change the baby's diaper when another woman sitting nearby removed a canister of pepper spray from her purse and sprayed it on the mother and her baby inadvertently also striking two Flight Attendants with pepper spray nearby. The flight was enroute from Miami, FL to New York, La Guardia when this occurred. The Captain diverted the flight to Jacksonville, FL where airport police met the flight. American Airlines Corporate Security spoke to the woman who said she thought she was spraying the mother and infant with air freshener and mistakenly grabbed the wrong dispenser causing the incident. It is unknown how the customer got through TSA security without the pepper spray being detected.
